Symptoms: Pre-emergence phase : Complete rotting of seedlings.; Post-emergence phase: Infected tissues become soft and water soaked.; Seedlings topple over or collapse.
Pathogen: Asexual : Zoospores bi-flagellated, thin walled. Resting spores : Oospore.
Favourable Conditions: High humidity, high soil moisture, cloudiness and low temperatures below 24°C for few days. ; Crowded seedlings, dampness due to high rainfall, poor drainage and excess of soil solutes.
Integrated Disease Management: Avoid stagnation of water.; Use raised beds of 15 cm height.; Drench with copper oxychloride 50% WP @ 2.5 g/l @ 4 l/sq.m.; Treat the seeds with metalaxyl-M 31.8% ES @ 2ml/ kg of seeds 24 hours before sowing.; Treat the seeds with Trichoderma asperellum @ 4 g/kg or Bacillus subtilis @ 10 g/kg of seeds 24 hours before sowing.; Soil application of Bacillus subtilis @ 2.5 kg/ha with 50 kg of FYM.

Pathogen: coloured, beaked conidia with  transverse and longitudinal septae, borne singly or in chains
Spread: Infected seed; Conidia carried through rain, wind borne.
Favourable Conditions: Warm, humid (24-29 degree C), rainy and wet weather.

Symptoms: Clearing of the veinlets and yellowing of the lower leaves.; Younger leaves die in succession.; Petiole and leaves droop and wilt.; Browning of vascular system.; Entire plant wilt and die.
Causal Organism: Fusarium oxysporum f.sp. lycopersii (Sacc.) W.C. Snyder & H.N. Hansen
Survival: In soil as mycelium and chlamydospores
Spread: Infected debris.; Water and planting equipment
Favourable Conditions: Dry weather (high soil temperature) and low soil moisture.
Integrated Disease Management: Soil solarization.; Crop rotation.; Removal of infected plant.; Seed treatment with Trichoderma asperellum (viride) @ 4g/kg seeds.; Seedling dip in B. subtilis @ 5g/l and soil application of B. subtilis@ 1.0 kg with 50 kg of FYM/ac at 30 days of transplanting.

Symptoms: Small, round to irregular spots with  grey centre and dark margin on leaves.; Spots coalesce and leaves are blighted.; Complete defoliation.; Stems and flowers are affected.
Spread: Mycelium or conidia.; Conidia through rain splash or wind.
Integrated Disease Management: Removal and destruction of affected plant parts.; Seed treatment :Trichoderma asperellum @ 4g/kg seeds.; Fluxapyroxad 250 g/l + Pyraclostrobin 250 g/l SC - 200-250 ml/ha.

Symptoms: Water-soaked black lesions on leaves and stems; Lesions expand rapidly and the entire leaf becomes necrotic.; White sporulation (sporangia and sporangiophores) on leaves.
Favourable Conditions: Cool nights, warm days and extended wet conditions from rain and fog.; Sporangia formed when RH is < 90%.; Optimum temp for sporulation is 18 - 22oC.
Integrated Disease Management: Proper drainage.; Crop rotation.; Soil application of Trichoderma asperellum (viride) @ 1.0 kg/ac.; Spray Cyazofamid 34.5% SC @ 80 ml/ac or Azoxystrobin 23% SC @ 200 ml/ac or Mancozeb 35% SC @ 1000 g/ac or Zineb 75% WP @ 800 g/ac or Azoxystrobin 18.2%+ Difenoconazole 11.4% SC @ 200 ml/ac

Spread: Infected plants.; Wounds, soil and implements.
Integrated Disease Management: Crop rotation.; Disease free seedlings.; Restriction of irrigation.; Drenching with bleaching powder @ 4 kg/ac.; Soil application of neem cake @ 100 kg/acre.

Symptoms: Severe stunting of plants; Downward rolling and crinkling of the leaves; Older leaves become leathery and brittle; Shortening of internodes; Appearence of more lateral branches - bushy appearance
Integrated Disease Management: Raising nursery in protected condition.; Growing Sorghum, Maize or Bajra as barrier crop.; Use of disease free seeds.; Yellow sticky traps @ 5nos./ac.; Remove alternate weed host - Abutilon indicum.; Spraying Dimethoate 30 EC @ 200 ml/ac or Methyl demeton 25 EC @ 200 ml/ac or Thiamethoxam 25 WG @ 200 g/ac or Imidacloprid 17.8 SL @ 200 ml/ac

Scientific Name: Groundnut bud necrosis virus / Tomato spotted wilt virus
Symptoms: Severe stunting .; Chlorotic or necrotic ringson leaves.; Thickening of veins and bronzing of young leaves.; Growing tips die-back and wilt.; Yellow areas with concentric circular markings  in fruit.; Discoloration of seed.
Causal Organism: Groundnut bud necrosis virus / Tomato spotted wilt virus
Spread: Infected plants.; Thrips, Frankliniella schultzii, Scirtothrips dorsalis.
Integrated Disease Management: Use of healthy seedlings for transplanting.; Rouging of infected plants upto 45 days of planting .; Growing sorghum, maize or bajra as barrier crop.; Apply any one of the following insecticide: Cyantraniliprole 10.26 OD @ 900 ml/ha,Thiamethoxam 70 WS @ 300 ml / ha,Imidachloprid 17.8 SL @ 250 ml / ha.

Symptoms: Seedlings, leaves, stem and fruits are affected; Spots on leaves, stems and fruits; White blister like spots in the margins of leaves and turn brown.; Wilting of leaves and shoots, streaks on stems and petioles.; Small, water soaked spots with white halo on fruits.; Centre of spots become slightly raised; tan coloured and rough; Cankers develop and form  cracks; slimy bacterial ooze through cracks.; Vascular discolouration.
Spread: Infected plant debris and seed.; Rain splash
Favourable Conditions: Soil temperature - 28°C.; High humidity or persistent dew.; Moist weather with intermittent showers
Integrated Disease Management: Field sanitation.; Crop rotation with non host crops.; Use of disease free seeds.; Disinfection of tools and implements.; Removal of weeds
